messages.author: akalin
messages.text: At some point it would be good to have an AppSyncData that contains an ExtensionSyncData plus the app-specific stuff.  You may want to do this as part of this CL or separately (before landing this one).

messages.author: akalin
messages.text: Specify that these return invalid ordinals for non-app extensions. (and setting them for non-app extensions is an error)

messages.author: csharp
messages.text:
On 2011/12/15 01:41:21, akalin wrote:
> Specify that these return invalid ordinals for non-app extensions. (and setting
> them for non-app extensions is an error)

Done, and I added a DCHECK to the setters to make sure that the extension is an app.

messages.author: SteveT
messages.text:
I'm not familiar with the policy around sync tests for extensions, but eventually (or even here) you might want to test for erroneous states in addition to valid states.

So for instance, what does the system do if it somehow receives multiple apps with the same ordinal value?

messages.author: akalin
messages.text:
On 2011/12/14 19:10:34, SteveT wrote:
> I'm not familiar with the policy around sync tests for extensions, but
> eventually (or even here) you might want to test for erroneous states in
> addition to valid states.
> 
> So for instance, what does the system do if it somehow receives multiple apps
> with the same ordinal value?

Yeah, we eventually want this.  Although it may make more sense to put it along with the code that actually listens for sync changes and sets the order.

messages.text: no curlies.

messages.author: csharp
messages.text:
On 2011/12/15 01:41:21, akalin wrote:
> On 2011/12/14 19:10:34, SteveT wrote:
> > I'm not familiar with the policy around sync tests for extensions, but
> > eventually (or even here) you might want to test for erroneous states in
> > addition to valid states.
> > 
> > So for instance, what does the system do if it somehow receives multiple apps
> > with the same ordinal value?
> 
> Yeah, we eventually want this.  Although it may make more sense to put it along
> with the code that actually listens for sync changes and sets the order.

I'll include those tests with the code that sets the order since that problem (multiple apps with the same value) will be the focus of that change.
